title: Format
description: Represents a creative format with its requirements

format_id.description: Structured format identifier with agent URL and format name

description.description: Plain text explanation of what this format does and what assets it requires

preview_image.description: DEPRECATED: Use format_card instead. Optional preview image URL for format browsing/discovery UI. Should be 400x300px (4:3 aspect ratio) PNG or JPG. Used as thumbnail/card image in format browsers. This field is maintained for backward compatibility but format_card provides a more flexible, structured approach.

example_url.description: Optional URL to showcase page with examples and interactive demos of this format

type.description: Media type of this format - determines rendering method and asset requirements

renders.description: Specification of rendered pieces for this format. Most formats produce a single render. Companion ad formats (video + banner), adaptive formats, and multi-placement formats produce multiple renders. Each render specifies its role and dimensions.

role.description: Semantic role of this rendered piece (e.g., 'primary', 'companion', 'mobile_variant')

assets_required.description: Array of required assets or asset groups for this format. Each asset is identified by its asset_id, which must be used as the key in creative manifests. Can contain individual assets or repeatable asset sequences (e.g., carousel products, slideshow frames).

asset_id.description: Unique identifier for this asset. Creative manifests MUST use this exact value as the key in the assets object.

asset_role.description: Optional descriptive label for this asset's purpose (e.g., 'hero_image', 'logo'). Not used for referencing assets in manifests—use asset_id instead. This field is for human-readable documentation and UI display only.

requirements.description: Technical requirements for this asset (dimensions, file size, duration, etc.)

oneOf.description: Repeatable asset group (for carousels, slideshows, playlists, etc.)

repeatable.description: Indicates this is a repeatable asset group

assets.description: Assets within each repetition of this group

asset_id.description: Identifier for this asset within the group

asset_role.description: Optional descriptive label for this asset's purpose (e.g., 'hero_image', 'logo'). Not used for referencing assets in manifests—use asset_id instead. This field is for human-readable documentation and UI display only.

required.description: Whether this asset is required in each repetition

delivery.description: Delivery method specifications (e.g., hosted, VAST, third-party tags)

supported_macros.description: List of universal macros supported by this format (e.g., MEDIA_BUY_ID, CACHEBUSTER, DEVICE_ID). Used for validation and developer tooling.

output_format_ids.description: For generative formats: array of format IDs that this format can generate. When a format accepts inputs like brand_manifest and message, this specifies what concrete output formats can be produced (e.g., a generative banner format might output standard image banner formats).

format_card.description: Optional standard visual card (300x400px) for displaying this format in user interfaces. Can be rendered via preview_creative or pre-generated.

format_id.description: Creative format defining the card layout (typically format_card_standard)

manifest.description: Asset manifest for rendering the card, structure defined by the format

format_card_detailed.description: Optional detailed card with carousel and full specifications. Provides rich format documentation similar to ad spec pages.

format_id.description: Creative format defining the detailed card layout (typically format_card_detailed)

manifest.description: Asset manifest for rendering the detailed card, structure defined by the format
